definition: citron daylily (Hemerocallis citrina Baroni)/golden needles (edible flower)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
lit. the dishes are cold (idiom)/fig. to arrive late/to take one's sweet time
pinyin: huang2 hua1 cai4 dou1 liang2 le5

sentences.english: Qidong people have cultivated daylily for over five hundred years.
sentences.chinese: 黃花菜在祁東縣的種植已有500多年的歷史。

sentences.english: This is because the water content of fresh day lily have Colchicine can cause poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲鮮黃花菜中含水量有秋水仙鹼，會引起中毒。

sentences.english: Opportunities and threats are both waiting for Qidong daylily.
sentences.chinese: 祁東黃花菜的發展是機遇與挑戰並存。

sentences.english: People often say, day lily is "lotos" for it can "soothe the nerves."
sentences.chinese: 人們常說，黃花菜是“忘憂草”，能安神解鬱。

sentences.english: Furnished a new method to multipurpose use the day lily.
sentences.chinese: 爲綜合利用黃花菜資源提供了一種新的方式。

sentences.english: Day lily is a traditional hi eat vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 黃花菜是人們喜喫的一種傳統蔬菜。

sentences.english: Daylily lotus soup, tender crisp scent, cools the blood detoxification.
sentences.chinese: 藕拌黃花菜，清香嫩脆，涼血解毒。

sentences.english: New China, local farmers have to again seven day lily cultivation.
sentences.chinese: 新中國建立後，當地農民重又栽培七須黃花菜。

definition: day lily (Hemerocallis), used in Chinese medicine and cuisine
long thread moss (Nostoc flagelliforme), an edible algae/also called faat choy or hair moss
Gorgon fruit/Semen euryales (botany)/see also 芡實|芡实[qian4 shi2]
